issue.summary: Gene apip on clone CR318591 has a possible sequence error
issue.description: Gene apip does not splice properly due to a possible sequence error caused by a repeat.
issue.resolution_text: CR318591 does not contain a sequence error. The sequence of CR318591 over the region containing the apip gene is correct, this is supported by whole genome shotgun component CABZ01023841. The reference genome represents a different fish to the supporting mRNA and EST evidence detailed in this ticket, that indicate a possible error. Gene app will be re-annotated on the current reference sequence.

issue.summary: Evidence from SATmap markers and Strand-seq analysis indicates that components within ctg764 require rearrangement with ctgs10376, 10252, 10535 and 17
issue.description: Evidence from SATmap markers and Strand-seq analysis indicates that components within ctg764 require rearrangement with ctgs10376, 10252, 10535 and 17
issue.resolution_text: Based on evidence from SATmap markers, and Strand-seq analysis a number of components within ctg764 have now been rearranged. In addition, marker evidence showed that ctgs 10376, 10252, 10535 and ctg17 all sat within ctg764. This region has now been reordered, and reorientated where necessary, consistent with the SATmap and Srand-seq data. This has led to the removal of ctg10252, and the production of ctg764_1 and ctg764_2.
